Package gw.plugin.document.impl

Class BaseMailMergeDocumentProductionImpl

java.lang.Object
gw.plugin.document.impl.BaseDocumentProductionImpl
gw.plugin.document.impl.BaseMailMergeDocumentProductionImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
InternalPlugin, IDocumentProduction, Remote
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseExcelDocumentProductionImpl, BaseWordDocumentProductionImpl
public abstract class BaseMailMergeDocumentProductionImpl extends BaseDocumentProductionImpl
Base class for IDocumentProduction implementations which use Microsoft MailMerge to generate documents (mainly Word and Excel).

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • createDocumentAsynchronously

      public String createDocumentAsynchronously(IDocumentTemplateDescriptor templateDescriptor, Map parameters)
      Description copied from interface: IDocumentProduction
      Attempt to create a document in an asynchronous manner.
      Parameters:
      templateDescriptor - The template from which to create the document.
      parameters - Any objects which may be required for document creation (for context object values, for example)
      Returns:
      A URL which the user could visit to see the status of the document creation, or null if none exists

    • createDocumentAsynchronously

      public String createDocumentAsynchronously(IDocumentTemplateDescriptor templateDescriptor, Map parameters, Map fieldValues)
      Description copied from interface: IDocumentProduction
      Attempt to create a document in an asynchronous manner.
      Parameters:
      templateDescriptor - The template from which to create the document.
      parameters - Any objects which may be required for document creation (for context object values, for example)
      fieldValues - A name->value Map of values which should be set in the new Document's metadata, once it is created
      Returns:
      A URL which the user could visit to see the status of the document creation, or null if none exists

    • createDocumentSynchronously

      public DocumentContentsInfo createDocumentSynchronously(IDocumentTemplateDescriptor templateDescriptor, Map parameters)
      Description copied from interface: IDocumentProduction
      Attempt to create a document in a synchronous manner.
      Parameters:
      templateDescriptor - The template from which to create the document.

    • createDocumentSynchronously

      public DocumentContentsInfo createDocumentSynchronously(IDocumentTemplateDescriptor templateDescriptor, Map parameters, Document document)
      Description copied from class: BaseDocumentProductionImpl
      Synchronously create a document from the given template descriptor and parameter map. The document parameter may be modified by to set certain fields.
      Specified by:
      createDocumentSynchronously in interface IDocumentProduction
      Overrides:
      createDocumentSynchronously in class BaseDocumentProductionImpl
      Parameters:
      templateDescriptor - The template descriptor on which the new document will be based
      parameters - A set of parameters which will be used as inputs to the document generation
      document - The new Document object which will be persisted to represent the new document content. It is permissible for the IDocumentProduction implementation to modify this object.
      Returns:
      A DocumentContentsInfo which contains the results of the document generation. For Excel documents, this will consist of a JavaScript file which, when returned to the client machine, will run to produce the document content.

    • makeStringFrom

      protected String makeStringFrom(Object obj)
      Return the string version of an object, suitable for insertion into the created document. In addition to the superclass operations, properly escapes commas and newlines, which is necessary because a csv format is used to perform the actual merge.
      Overrides:
      makeStringFrom in class BaseDocumentProductionImpl
      Parameters:
      obj - The object whose string representation should be returned
      Returns:
      The appropriate string representation of the object.
